metadata.title: CVE-2015-3239 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: Off-by-one error in the dwarf_to_unw_regnum function in include/dwarf_i.h in libunwind 1.1 allows local users to have unspecified impact via invalid dwarf opcodes.

notes.note: seth-arnold> I saw nothing in callers of this macro that would prevent less-than-zero accesses: input params were sometimes integers, sometimes harder to determine the type. Debian codesearch shows many duplications of the <= mistake with dwarf_to_unw_regnum arrays in other files, not just the one dwarf_i.h.

criterions.comment: android-platform-external-libunwind package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.1.0+r23-2').
libunwind package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1-4.1').
racket package in hirsute is affected and needs fixing.
